text: Divock Okoth Origi (born 18 April 1995) is a Belgian professional footballer. He plays for AC Milan and the Belgium national team. He plays as a forward. He was born in Ostend. He is the son of former Kenyan professional footballer Mike Origi. Origi started his career at French club Lille. In 2014, he signed for Liverpool for £10 million. He has since spent time on loan at Lille and VfL Wolfsburg as a Liverpool player. On 2 December 2018, after coming on as a substitute, he scored his side's 96th minute 1–0 winner over Everton in the Premier League. On 7 May 2019, he scored two goals for Liverpool (including the overall tie winner) in a 4–0 win over Barcelona in the UEFA Champions League semi-final. In the final of the competition, in the 87th minute, Origi scored Liverpool's second goal in the side's 2–0 victory over Tottenham Hotspur. Origi has played for Belgium since 2014. He has played for his country 25 times, scoring three times. He was part of the 2014 FIFA World Cup squad. ==Honours== Liverpool *UEFA Champions League: 2018–19 *UEFA Super Cup: 2019 *FIFA Club World Cup: 2019 *Football League Cup runner-up: 2015–16 *UEFA Europa League runner-up: 2015–16 ==References== ==Other websites== *Divock Origi at the Liverpool F.C. website * Category:1995 births Category:Living people Category:2014 FIFA World Cup players Category:Belgian footballers Category:Liverpool F.C. players Category:Nottingham Forest F.C. players Category:People from West Flanders Category:Premier League players Category:Bundesliga players Category:UEFA Euro 2016 players Category:2022 FIFA World Cup players
title: Divock Origi
